sentence.Network_en: What happens when the two interests collide will make a fascinating spectacle.
sentence.Network_cn: 两种利益发生冲突时将会上演一场好戏。

sentence.Network_en: It was a spectacle not to be missed.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是个不容错过的奇观。

sentence.Network_en: 94,000 people turned up for the spectacle.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 大学英语六级词汇表_大学六级 ... specimen n． 范例，样品，标本 spectacle n． 景象；壮观；场面 spectator n． 观众,目击者,旁观 …
景观指的是，世界被建构为一个景观（spectacle），所有日常中的全部，皆可经由公开展示。除此，人们具有自恋（narcissism）倾 …
认同的奇观(spectacle) ? 个体先验(individuality-transcending)的相同性有时被当作将不确定所带来之焦虑一扫而空的方式。

jx.jx_en_mean: draw attention to oneself by behaving in a ridiculous way in public

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin spectaculum 'public show', from spectare, frequentative of specere 'to look'

entry.def: Glasses are sometimes referred to as spectacles .

example.ex: He looked at me over the tops of his spectacles.
example.tran: 他从眼镜框的上方看了看我。

entry.tran: 奇异的景象;有趣的场面
entry.def: A spectacle is a strange or interesting sight.

example.ex: It was a spectacle not to be missed.
example.tran: 这是个不容错过的奇观。

entry.tran: 盛大的演出;壮观的场面
entry.def: A spectacle is a grand and impressive event or performance.

example.ex: 94,000 people turned up for the spectacle.
example.tran: 94,000 人参加了这一盛大活动。

example.ex: ...a director passionate about music and spectacle.
example.tran: 对音乐和盛大演出充满激情的指挥

means.word_mean: 1. something or someone seen (especially a notable or unusual sight);

sentences.sentence: "the tragic spectacle of cripples trying to escape"

means.word_mean: 2. an elaborate and remarkable display on a lavish scale
3. a blunder that makes you look ridiculous; used in the phrase `make a spectacle of' yourself

auth_sentence.content: You would say that the spectacle had a content.
auth_sentence.res_content: You would say that the spectacle had a content.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You would say that the spectacle had a content.

auth_sentence.content: The sending off killed the game as a spectacle.
auth_sentence.res_content: The sending off killed the game as a spectacle.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The sending off killed the game as a spectacle.

auth_sentence.content: His friendships, too, were an unedifying spectacle.
auth_sentence.res_content: His friendships, too, were an unedifying spectacle.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His friendships, too, were an unedifying spectacle.

stems_affixes.word_buile: circum周围+spect看→看周围→小心
per全部+spect看+ive……的→看透了的→透视的
prospect前景+ive……的→adj.预期的
respect尊敬+able可以……的→adj.可敬的;人格高尚的
respect尊敬,尊重+ful有……的→adj.恭敬的,尊重的
re回+spect看+ive……的→回头看[自己]→各自的
retrospect[v.回顾,回想]+ive……的→adj.追想的,回顾的
spect看+acular……的→adj.壮观的,引人注目的 n.壮观的演出
respective[adj.各自的,各个的]+ly表副词→adv.分别地, 各个地
pro前面+spect看→向前看→前景

stems_affixes.value_cn: 样子, 外表, 面貌, [问题等的]方面
stems_affixes.word_buile: a加强意义+spect看→看的东西→外表,容貌
circumspect[adj.小心谨慎的]+ion表名词→n.细心,慎重
inspect[v.检查,调查,视察]+or人→n.检查员, 巡视员
inspect[v.检查,调查,视察]+ion表名词→n.检查,审查;检阅

stems_affixes.value_cn: 章程,内容简介;创办计划
stems_affixes.word_buile: pro前+spect看+us→向前看的东西
re再+spect看→再看[一眼]→尊敬
spect看+acle东西→看的东西→景象;眼镜
spect看+acular……的→adj.壮观的,引人注目的 n.壮观的演出
spect看+ator人→看的人
spect看+rum→可以看的范围
re再+spect看→再看[一眼]→尊敬
ex出+pect=spect看→看出去,看外面→期待
in内,里面+spect看→看里面→检查
retro向后+spect看→向后看
spec=spect看+ulate→看准了→思考,投机
sus下面+spect看→在下面看一看,斜眼看→怀疑

sentences.en: The spectacle greatly excited us at the time.
sentences.cn: 当时那场面令我们十分激动。

sentences.en: People wear spectacles so that they can see better.
sentences.cn: 人们戴眼镜是为了看得更清楚。

jushi.english: The spectacle greatly excited us at the time.
jushi.chinese: 当时那场面令我们十分激动。

jushi.english: We sat down to study and enjoy this singular spectacle.
jushi.chinese: 我们坐下来观赏这奇异的景色。

jushi.english: Gold rimmed spectacles bit deep into the bridge of his nose.
jushi.chinese: 金边眼镜深深嵌入他的鼻梁。
